text.value:
Here are the steps to add a project to Git version control:
1. Navigate to the project directory in your terminal/command prompt.
2. Initialize a new Git repository by running:
```bash git init ```
3. Add all the files in the project to the staging area by running:
```bash git add . ```
4. Commit the files with an initial commit message:
```bash git commit -m "Initial commit" ```
5. Add a remote origin URL pointing to a new repository on GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket etc:
```bash git remote add origin <remote_url> ```
6. Push the commits to the remote repository:
```bash git push -u origin master ```
Now your project is version controlled with Git and hosted on the remote repository. You can make changes locally, commit them and push to update the remote.
Let me know if you need any clarification or have additional questions!
